name: Kachufool
shortDescription: A digital adaptation of the popular Indian trick-taking card game, playable with up to six opponents.
fullDescription:
Kachufool is a trick-taking card game where players predict the number of 'hands' or 'tricks' they can win in a round. The digital version features a competitive multiplayer table layout accommodating up to six players (or AI opponents).

Key Features:

  • Classic Indian Card Game: Based on the traditional trick-taking card game rules.
  • Multiplayer Support: Playable with up to six players/opponents (AI or human).
  • 'Hakum' (Trump) Suit: The current Trump suit is clearly indicated for easy gameplay.
  • Simple Interface: The game easily tracks whose turn it is, the current round number, and the number of tricks won by each player.
